roleset.name: make a copy, the act of making a copy
roleset.note: COPY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'copy' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 25.2 and 25.4, Framenet entry Duplication. (from copy.01-v)
COPY-N NOTES: Based on verb entry copy.01; corresponds to Verbnet entries 25.2 and 25.4. (from copy.01-n)
COPYING-N NOTES: Based on verb entry copy.01; corresponds to Verbnet entries 25.2 and 25.4. (from copying.01-n)

roles.note: Watch out for instances that denote artifacts; physical copies are not events. (from copy.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: When test booklets were passed out 48 hours ahead of time, she says she copied questions in the social studies section and gave the answers to students.
example.arg: questions in the social studies section

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: Thus the Yingko Ceramics Museum 's only option was to find someone *whnp-0*-1 *-1 to make copies of the originals .

example.name: Args 1, 2
example.text: Do it prior to the copy of data into each of the files.

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: Thus the Yingko Ceramics Museum 's only option was to find someone *whnp-0*-1 *-1 to make copies of the originals .

example.name: Args 1, 2
example.text: Do it prior to the copying of data into each of the files.

roleset.name: send a copy to
roleset.note: COPY-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from copy.03-v)

example.name: args 1,2
example.text: Email sent ! You-1 're copied *T*-1 on it , so you should be able to see it in your email too .

roleset.name: make a copy, don't mention copy

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: I have a right to print those scripts if I go there and laboriously -- but no longer surreptitiously -- copy them out in long hand .
